svt_i2c_xtor_configuration Class Reference

Inheritance diagram for class svt_i2c_xtor_configuration:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

Synthesizable transactor port configuration class contains configuration information which is applicable to individual synthesizable ENET XTOR components. Any configuration parameter that conflicts in this class takes precedence over equivalent SVT VIP configuration parameters. The svt_configuration :: inst property specifies the full path to the synthesizable BFM module/interface instance in the synthesizable testbench that corresponds to this VIP instance.

Member Attribute Documentation

 bit  attribute
 svt_i2c_xtor_configuration::enable_receive_polling_frequency = 1

enable_receive_polling_frequency controls whether VIP should poll XTOR, checking whether there are packets in XTOR receive buffer queue, those which can be retrieved from C side and sent back to SV.

 bit  attribute
 svt_i2c_xtor_configuration::enable_scoreboard

This property enables scoreboard in XTOR environment.

 chandle  attribute
 svt_i2c_xtor_configuration::hw_platform = null

Reference to a specialization of the C++ svt_hw_platform class that specifies the nature of the hardware platform where the synthesizable portion of the VIP is executing.

If null (default), the hardware platform specified in the default C runtime descriptor.

 int  attribute
 svt_i2c_xtor_configuration::receive_polling_frequency = 5

SVT VIP polls XTOR,checking whether packet is available or not. receive_polling_frequency controls at which frequency VIP should poll XTOR for packets.
